etymologies: Middle English: from Old French lentille, from Latin lenticula, diminutive of lens, lent- ‘lentil’

definitions: a high-protein pulse that is dried and then soaked and cooked before eating. There are several varieties of lentils, including green ones and smaller orange ones, which are typically sold split.
shortDefinitions: high-protein pulse which is dried and then soaked and cooked prior to eating

definitions: the plant which yields lentils, native to the Mediterranean and Africa and grown also for fodder.
shortDefinitions: plant which yields lentils, native to Mediterranean and Africa and grown also for fodder
